intro: Heptapleurum dongnaiense var. langbianense, commonly known as the Langbian variety of the Dong Nai heptapleurum, is a rare evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Actinidiaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves with a glossy surface. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions with high rainfall. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, while its fruit is a small, fleshy berry. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
